normalised: I remember when I first started investing in the stock market. My uncle, Rajesh Khanna, told me to invest in Tata Motors back in two thousand and ten. He said, "Beta, invest just rupee five thousand. You'll see, in the long run, it will grow." I was hesitant, but I listened to him. Bought some shares at around rupee sixty per share then.

unnormalised: Fast forward to 2024, I was checking my portfolio. Tata Motors was trading at around Rs. 950! That initial investment had grown significantly. Then I started reading more and more. Zerodha articles, Moneycontrol website, and also started understanding the basics of SIPs and mutual funds. The gains that I got from Tata Motors helped in my confidence to explore these. I also learned about different taxes like STCG and LTCG.
normalised: Fast forward to two thousand and twenty four, I was checking my portfolio. Tata Motors was trading at around rupee nine hundred and fifty! That initial investment had grown significantly. Then I started reading more and more. Z-e-r-o-d-h-a articles, Moneycontrol website, and also started understanding the basics of S-I-P-s and mutual funds. The gains that I got from Tata Motors helped in my confidence to explore these. I also learned about different taxes like S-T-C-G and L-T-C-G.

unnormalised: Now, I invest a bit more regularly, and I'm even looking at diversifying into international stocks. But I'll always remember that initial Rs. 5000 investment. So, my advice, start small, learn from experienced people like my uncle, and don't be afraid to take calculated risks.
